intro: Bilabrella luegiana, commonly known as the Luegian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and lanceolate, often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Bilabrella luegiana is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
